overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a detailed analytical process for forecasting hourly oil temperature data. It begins by assessing data completeness and seasonality, evaluates advanced models like SARIMA and exponential smoothing, but ultimately adopts a heuristic approach due to data limitations (only 4 days of history). The method focuses on per-hour average daily changes applied to the last observed day, with explicit consideration of volatility and practical constraints.
key_insights: Prioritized simplicity due to limited historical data (96 points)
Used per-hour average daily deltas for trend projection
Extrapolated forecasts by applying incremental changes to the last observed day
Rounded outputs to match input precision (3 decimal places)
Acknowledged limitations of linear extrapolation for volatile data
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex: Combines model evaluation (SARIMA/ETS) with practical heuristic implementation, including multi-step calculations of hourly deltas and trend projections, while addressing data constraints.
